data.title: The Sumner County Election Commission
data.meta_description: The Sumner County Election Commission conducts all elections; city, county, state and federal. State election laws are the foundation of all procedures in TN.
data.text:
Next Election: November 5, 2024

State and Federal General and Municipal Elections

Candidate Information

First day to pull a petition to qualify for the November ballot is Monday, June 17, 2024.

Candidate qualifying deadline NOON, Thursday, August 15, 2024.

Withdrawal deadline is NOON, Thursday, August 22, 2024.

Sumner County Sheriff Qualification timetable and Information

Additional candidate information is located under our RESOURCES tab.

View theNOVEMBER FACTSHEET for list of offices on the ballot.

Please note: Potential candidates should file their Appointment of Political Treasurer form before raising or spending any money. Those forms and additional candidate information is located under our RESOURCES tab.

NOVEMBER 5, 2024 CANDIDATE PETITION REPORT

Voter Information

Last day to register to vote: October 7, 2024.

First day to request an absentee ballot: August 7, 2024.

Printable absentee form click here

Last day to request and mail an absentee ballot: October 29, 2024.

Early voting: October 16th thru October 31st.

August 1, 2024 Election: State and Federal Primary and Sumner County General

Unofficial Results

Early and Absentee

29 out of 29 Precincts

Precinct by Precinct Results

HOW TO REGISTER TO VOTE -

Click on the Blue Register to Vote icon above to start the online process. You can also make name or address changes to your existing registration. Registration deadline to be eligible to vote in the November Election is October 7, 2024

Below you can choose to print a form to register or make changes and mail to our office,

Printable Voter Registration Application Form

Frequently Asked Questions

Check Your Voter Statuswith Voter Lookup (updated weekly by State Election office)

Check Your Legislative District Status with TN District Lookup (updated weekly by State Election office) Just input your home address to obtain the most current information.

What is required for voting?

Do I have to show up to vote?

Find Your Polling Location

Update voter Registration/Address Change/Name Change

Absentee Voting link to the TN Division of Elections (including all reasons for voting absentee)

Absentee Ballot Request Form (fillable)

Military/Overseas Voting

Military/Overseas Form 76

Are you required to register by political party in Tennessee?

Restore Voting Rights

Purging Voter Registration

In case of death how is a registration purged?

Is my voter registration public record?

Physician's Statement (Dr. Certified form)

How to Read & Use Your Voter Registration Card

Tennessee Honor Vote Program

Dedicate your vote to those who are serving or have served in the U.S. Military. For more information click HERE

2024 UPCOMING ELECTIONS: November 5, 2024click here

Key dates for 2024 Elections

COMMISSION MEETING INFORMATION:

Next scheduled meeting to be held Friday, August 16, 2024 at 1019 Union School Rd, Gallatin at 9:00 am.

Special Call Meeting to be held Thursday, August 22, 2024 at 1019 Union School Rd, Gallatin at 4:00 pm.

The Sumner County Election Commission meets monthly, the second Tuesday of the month at 4:00 pm unless otherwise specified.

NOTICE OF REGULAR ELECTION COMMISSION MEETINGS

AGENDAS & MINUTESCLICK HERE

How to signup for public comments CLICK HERE

Hours and Holidays CLICK HERE

Serve your community as a poll worker

Interested in serving your community as a Poll Worker? For information call (615) 452-1456 or email to pollworker@sumnercountytn.gov or click below.

To sign up CLICK HERE .

Tennessee Ranked #1 in the Country when it comes to Election Integrity!

The Heritage Foundation ranked us the top in the nation when it comes to protecting your vote.
